intro: Hibbertia diffusa var. oblongata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Dilleniaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, where it typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with prominent red stamens. It is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, and it is adapted to thrive in full sun. Hibbertia diffusa var. oblongata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
